column4: I have a driver running right now that I need to reconfig. I can't "make" the new driver because it says that the driver is already enabled in the kernel. I'm pretty lost right now as to what I need to do, any help would be amazing.
what do you mean by reconfig?
, ya get what I mean? I can't make the new driver because it says the old driver is already enabled in the kernel.
if you really need to compile a driver that's included in the ubuntu kernel you probably need to custom compile your kernel as well, what driver is this?
, it's a driver for an orinoco classic gold wifi card. it is needed to get monitor mode to run.
, i just jumped the gun and ran make on the file before i edited the config file so now it gives me the error:  This driver is already enabled in the kernel.
if you just ran make and not make install or anything else it shouldn't have done anything you can't reverse with make distclean (if this is a nicely made makefile)
, no rule to support make clean or make distclean
unfortunately no, I have no experience with that driver
, besides a make clean or make install. what else is there to do in order to disable to installed driver so i can install the new?
thanks anyways, much appreciated for the effort.
removing drivers that are in use can lead to bad things

, well its for a pcmcia wifi card that just needs monitor mode enabled in a line of code. i have the correctly configd driver right here just waiting to be installed after the original one is disabled
dude, honestly I have no idea what you need to do, I'm sorry
